docTitle.titlePart:
β-Decay and the electric dipole moment:
Searches for time-reversal violation in radioactive
nuclei and atoms

byline.docAuthor:
H W WILSCHUT
* , U DAMMALAPATI, D J VAN DER HOEK,
K JUNGMANN, W KRUITHOF, C J G ONDERWATER, B SANTRA,
P D SHIDLING and L WILLMANN

byline.affiliation: Kernfysisch Versneller Instituut, University of Groningen,

front.div:
Abstract. One of the greatest successes of the Standard Model of particle physics is
the explanation of time-reversal violation (TRV) in heavy mesons. It also implies that
TRV is immeasurably small in normal nuclear matter. However, unifying models beyond
the Standard Model predict TRV to be within reach of measurement in nuclei and atoms,
thus opening an important window to search for new physics. We will discuss two com-
plementary experiments sensitive to TRV: Correlations in the β-decay of
21 Na and the
search for an electric dipole moment (EDM) in radium.
front.keyword: Keywords. β-decay; electric dipole moment; searches for new physics.
